contents:
Hello lovely people!
Welcome back to VideoTranslator support where we will be telling you the tips and tricks regarding the media and translation world.
In the previous post, we have written about how you can create, import, and edit SRT files.
This time, we will be explaining how you can add subtitles to your YouTube, Facebook, and LinkedIn video.
So, without further ado, let’s begin!
Adding Subtitles To YouTube Videos Have you ever been on noisy public transport rides and struggled to watch your favorite YouTuber’s video? Well, that’s because the video has no subtitles.
Having subtitles to your video will help a great deal of people, especially deaf or hard-of-hearing viewers.
Most of the time, people do not like adding subtitles because it takes a lot of time and effort to do so.
YouTube tried to solve this problem by generating automatic captions.
Automatic Captions If automatic captions are available, YouTube will automatically generate captions.
Youtube generating automatic captions  
 Currently, automatic captions are available in Dutch, English, French, German, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Turkish, and Vietnamese.
 However, it is highly encouraged that you add professional captions first.
Automatic captions will not be accurate due to many different reasons. It can be because of mispronunciations, accents, dialects, or background noise.
Adding Professional Captions and Subtitles To add professional captions and subtitles on YouTube, you want to follow the following steps:
  Sign in to your YouTube account and go to YouTube Studio.
  From the left menu, select Subtitles.
  Select the video that you would like to edit.
  Click add language
How to add video subtitles on youtube  
  Select your language.
  Choose either Title & description or Subtitles, click add.
Choose whether you want to add title & description or subtitles on youtube  
  If you choose to add subtitles, there are 3 ways to do that - uploading a file, type manually, or auto-translate.
Adding Subtitles By Uploading A File In the previous post, we did explain to you how you can create your subtitle file. If you already have your file ready, you can easily upload your file on YouTube!
Here’s how to do it:
  Click subtitles > add.
  Select Upload File.
Adding subtitle on youtube by uploading a file  
  Choose between With Timing or Without Timing, then select Continue.
  Choose a file to upload.
  Select Save.
  Adding Subtitles By Typing Manually If you do not have your SRT file, don’t worry. YouTube allows you to manually add it.
Here’s how you can manually add your subtitles:
  Click subtitles > add.
  Click type manually.
  Type your subtitles in the caption box and adjust the timing.
  If you want to download your subtitles into an SRT file, you can click on the 3 horizontal dots next to the ‘edit as text’ writing and click download subtitles.
Adding subtitle on youtube by typing manually  
  When you are done, click publish.
  Adding Subtitles By Auto Translate Although English is widely spoken and understood, many people are not comfortable watching video content in English. So, to accommodate viewers who speak another language, you may choose to auto-translate your videos.
To do this, you have to:
  Click subtitles > add.
  Click auto-translate.
Adding subtitle on youtube by auto-translate  
  Your subtitles will be automatically translated.
  Note: This method works based on YouTube’s technology to automatically translate your videos. If you understand the target language, you will still need to edit the auto-translated subtitles to ensure the accuracy of the translation.
Adding Subtitles To Facebook Videos Facebook now has a tab called Watch where you can watch video content on Facebook. This tab is very addicting and you can easily spend hours scrolling through it.
Unlike YouTube, you can set a preference where the videos you’re watching on Facebook are automatically muted until you change the preference.
So, how can you intrigue the interest of viewers who have their video muted? Well, the answer is by adding subtitles.
To add subtitles on Facebook, you have to do the following:
  Click Photo/Video at the top of your timeline or News Feed.
  Choose a video from your computer, then click upload.
  Click video options and click add captions. Here, you can choose whether you want to upload your own file or have your video captions auto-generated.
How to add subtitle on facebook  
  If you choose to upload your captions, click the upload tab and select an srt file from your computer. Click upload.
Upload your captions on facebook  
  Click Save.
  Naming Your Facebook SRT File Facebook is quite strict when it comes to naming your SRT file.
So, you need to make sure that your SRT file has been properly named.
The naming format that Facebook prefers is:
filename.[language code]_[country code].srt
Language and country codes are case-sensitive. Language needs to be in lower case and the country needs to be in upper case.
For example, a United Kingdom English file would look like: filename.en_UK.srt.
You can find the language and country code list here.
Adding Subtitles To LinkedIn Videos Although LinkedIn is not a popular site to share videos, there is no reason why you can’t share one.
If you happen to be sharing a video on LinkedIn, having subtitles will make your video stand out.
You can add subtitles to your LinkedIn videos by doing the following:
 Click the Video icon from your share box.  How to add subtitle on your linkedin video   2. Select your video and click upload. 3. Click Edit in the top right corner to view your video‚Äôs settings.
Click on the pen icon to add captions on linkedin video   4. If you scroll down, you will be able to find ‘Video Caption File (SRT Only)’. Click select caption.
Upload your caption on your linkedin video   5. Select your SRT file and click upload. When you are finished, you can click done.
Conclusion In this article, we have discussed how you can add subtitles to your YouTube, Facebook, and LinkedIn videos.
It’s easy, isn’t it!
Now that you are an expert, why don’t you try VideoTranslator to transcribe, translate and dub your video? Read how you can conveniently translate your video here.
For more information regarding VideoTranslator, do not hesitate to contact us at hello@videotranslator.ai.
See you next time for more educational blog posts!

Halo, semuanya!
Kembali lagi bersama Video Translator dimana kami akan memberikan tips and tricks tentang dunia media dan terjemahan.
Kali ini, kami akan membahas cara agar kalian bisa mengimpor dan mengedit file SRT ke Adobe Premiere Pro.
Sebelum mulai, yuk kita cari tahu apa sih file SRT…
Apa Itu SRT? SRT adalah file teks biasa yang berisi informasi penting mengenai subtitle, termasuk kode waktu awal dan akhir teks kalian untuk memastikan subtitle kalian cocok dengan audio kalian, dan nomor urut subtitle.
Dengan memiliki SRT, video kalian akan memiliki subtitle atau teks di layar. Memiliki subtitle atau teks pada video bakalan sangat membantu banyak orang, loh, terutama mereka yang memiliki gangguan pendengaran.
Bagaimana Cara Membuat File SRT? Secara garis besar, kalian bisa bisa membuat file SRT dengan menggunakan editor teks apapun atau dengan menggunakan software SRT.
Menggunakan Editor Text Untuk Membuat File SRT Untuk membuat file SRT di editor text, gunakan langkah-langkah berikut:
 Buka text editor apa saja, misalnya TextEdit atau Notepad. Urutkan garis caption dengan nomor yang dimulai dari angka 1. Tekan enter dan tempatkan cap waktu. Format dari cap waktu yang akan kalian tempatkan adalah ‘jam:menit:detik,milidetik –> jam:menit:detik,milidetik’. Tekan enter lagi dan mulailah menulis caption kalian.  Pastikan kalian tidak mengacaukan format cap waktu.
Menyimpan FIle SRT Dari TextEdit Di Mac Buka aplikasi TextEdit di Mac kalian.
  Urutkan garis caption dengan nomor yang dimulai dari angka 1.
  Tekan enter dan tempatkan cap waktu. Format dari cap waktu yang akan kalian tempatkan adalah ‘jam:menit:detik,milidetik –> jam:menit:detik,milidetik’.
  Tekan enter lagi dan mulailah menulis caption kalian.
  Klik Format > ‘Make Plain Text’.
Pastikan kalian sudah mengatur 'make plain text' di TextEdit untuk membuat file SRT  
  Klik File > save.
  Di kolom Save As, ketik nama file kalian. TextEdit akan secara otomatis membuat extension file kalian menjadi .txt jadi kalian harus menggantinya menjadi .srt.
Menyimpan file SRT di TextEdit  
  Hapus centang tulisan ‘If no extension is provided, use .txt’ dan klik save.
  Menggunakan VideoTranslator Untuk Membuat File SRT Kalau kalian tidak mau membuat file SRT secara manual, kalian bisa menggunakan VideoTranslator. VideoTranslator menggunakan kecerdasan buatan untuk mentranskripsikan video kalian. Dengan menggunakan VideoTranslator, kalian bisa menghemat banyak waktu.
Berikut merupakan langkah-langkah yang harus kalian lakukan untuk membuat file SRT dari VideoTranslator:
  Kunjungi halaman www.videotranslator.ai
  Kalau kalian sudah memiliki akun, masuk ke akun kalian. Kalau kalian belum memiliki akun, kalian. bisa membuat akun baru atau melakukan percobaan gratis.
  Unggah video kalian melalui tombol quicktranscribe.
  Pilih bahasa dan dialek dari video kalian dan pencet tombol accept untuk melakukan transkripsi.
Menggunakan VideoTranslator untuk membuat file SRT  
  Setelah proses transkripsi selesai, cek kembali hasil transkripsi dan benarkan tata bahasa seperti huruf kapital dan tanda titik.
  Unduh file srt.
  Cara Mengimpor File SRT Ke Adobe Premiere Pro Nah, setelah kalian tau gimana sih cara membuat file SRT, kalian bisa mengimpor file kalian ke Adobe Premiere Pro.
Berikut adalah cara untuk mengimpor file SRT di Adobe Premiere Pro:
 Buka proyek kalian di Adobe Premiere Pro. Adobe Premiere Pro yang kami gunakan adalah versi 2020. Impor subtitle dengan mengklik File > Impor dan temukan file subtitle kalian kemudian klik impor.  Atau, kalian bisa menyeret file subtitle ke timeline.
Cara Mengedit File SRT Ke Adobe Premiere Pro Ada dua cara untuk mengedit subtitle di Adobe Premiere Pro.
Cara Pertama Untuk Mengedit Subtitle Di Adobe Premiere Pro   Pergi ke Window > Caption
Klik tombol caption untuk mengedit subtitle kalian di Adobe Premiere Pro  
  Klik import settings. Disini, kalian bisa melakukan pengaturan subtitle seperti font style, font size, dan lokasi subtitle secara keseluruhan.
Klik tombol import untuk mengedit subtitle kalian di Adobe Premiere Pro  
  Dengan melakukan metode ini, seluruh pengaturan subtitle kalian akan seragam.
Settingan caption di Adobe Premiere Pro  
  Cara Kedua Untuk Mengedit Subtitle Di Adobe Premiere Pro  Pastikan bahwa file SRT kalian sudah ada di timeline. Klik dua kali di file subtitle kalian. Halaman caption akan dibuka. Disini, kalian bisa mengatur subtitle kalian satu persatu.  Metode ini bagus jika kaliaj hanya ingin mengedit beberapa bagian dari subtitle.Mengedit subtitle di Adobe Premiere Pro secara manual  
Apa yang Harus Saya Lakukan Jika Saya Tidak Dapat Mengimpor File SRT Ke Adobe Premiere Pro? Jika kalian tidak bisa mengunggah file SRT kalian ke Adobe Premiere Pro, kalian bisan mencoba cara berikut ini:
  Klik ikon kunci inggris di timeline.
Cara untuk mengimport file SRT ke Adobe Premiere Pro  
  Pergi ke Closed Captions Display dan pastikan bahwa kalian sudah mengaktifkan fungsi ini dengan mengklik ‘enable’.Pastikan fungsi 'enable closed captions' di Adobe Premiere Pro sudah diaktifkan untuk menambahkan subtitle  
  Mengekspor Video Dengan Subtitle Dalam Adobe Premiere Pro Untuk mengekspor video dengan subtitle di Adobe Premiere Pro, kalian dapat melakukan hal berikut:
 Klik File > Export. Atau, kalian bisa memencet tombol command + M (untuk Mac). Pilih pengaturan export dan preset. Klik export.  Video kalian akan secara otomatis memiliki subtitle yang sudah tertanam.
Kesimpulan Di artikel ini, kita telah membahasa tentang apa itu SRT, berbagai cara untuk membuat file SRT, cara mengimpor dan mengedit file SRT ke Adobe Premiere Pro dan cara mengekspor video dengan subtitle di Adobe Premiere Pro.
Sekarang, kalian udah jago nih tentang hal mengenai SRT dan Adobe Premiere Pro. Nah, kenapa kalian nggak mencoba VideoTranslator untuk mentranskripsikan, menerjemahkan, dan menyulih suara video ? Baca bagaimana kalian bisa dengan mudah menerjemahkan video kalian di sini.
Untuk informasi lebih lanjut mengenai VideoTranslator, jangan ragu-ragu untuk menghubungi kami di hello@videotranslator.ai.
Sampai jumpa lagi di artikel edukasi berikutnya!
title: Cara Mengimpor Dan Mengedit File SRT Ke Adobe Premiere Pro

contents:
Hello, fam!
Welcome back again to VideoTranslator support where we will be telling you the tips and tricks regarding the media and translation world.
This time, we will be explaining how you can import and edit SRT files to Adobe Premiere Pro.
Before we begin, let’s explain what an SRT file is first…
What Is SRT? SRT is a plain-text file that contains critical information regarding subtitles, including the start and end timecodes of your text to ensure your subtitles match your audio, and the sequential number of subtitles.
By having an SRT, your video will have subtitles or captions. Having subtitles or captions on your video will be very helpful for many people, especially the ones with hearing impairments.
How To Create An SRT File? Generally, you can create an SRT file in any text editor or by using SRT software.
Using Text Editor To Create An SRT File To create an SRT file by using a text editor, you have to follow the below steps:
 Open any text editor, such as TextEdit or Notepad. Order your caption lines with a number beginning from 1. Click enter and put your timestamp. The format of the timestamp will be ‘hours:minutes:seconds,milliseconds –> hours:minutes:seconds,milliseconds’. Click enter again and start writing your caption.  Do make sure that you do not mess up the timestamp format.
Creating and editing your SRT file with TextEdit  
Saving An SRT File From TextEdit on Mac Open TextEdit on your Mac.
  Order your caption lines with a number beginning from 1.
  Click enter and put your timestamp. The format of the timestamp will be ‘hours:minutes:seconds,milliseconds –> hours:minutes:seconds,milliseconds’.
  Click enter again and start writing your caption.
  Go to Format and click on ‘Make Plain Text’.
Make sure that you have set make plain text in TextEdit to make SRT file  
  Go to File and click save.
  In the Save As text field, type down your file name. TextEdit will automatically put the file extension to .txt so you want to change it to .srt.
Saving your SRT file in TextEdit  
  Uncheck the ‘If no extension is provided, use .txt’ box and click save.
  Using VideoTranslator To Create An SRT File If you do not want to manually create an SRT file, you can use VideoTranslator. VideoTranslator uses AI to automatically transcribe your video. By using VideoTranslator, you can save a lot of time.
Here’s what you have to do to use VideoTranslator to create an SRT file:
  Go to www.videotranslator.ai
  If you already have an account, log in to your account. If you do not have an account, you can create an account or have a free trial.
  Upload your video using the quicktranscribe button.
  Select the language and dialect of the video and click the accept button to trigger the transcription. The transcription process will run in the background.
Use VideoTranslator to transcribe, translate and dub your videos  
  Once the transcription is complete, go through and check the transcription for proper grammar e.g. capitalisation and full stops.
  Download the srt file.
  How To Import SRT File To Adobe Premiere Pro Now that you know how to create an SRT file, you are good to import your file to Adobe Premiere Pro.
Here is how you can import an SRT file in Adobe Premiere Pro:
 Open your project in Adobe Premiere Pro. The Adobe Premiere Pro we use is the 2020 version. Import the subtitle by clicking File > Import and find your subtitle file then click import.  Alternatively, you can drag your subtitle file to your timeline.
How To Edit Subtitle In Adobe Premiere Pro There are two ways for you to edit your subtitle in Adobe Premiere Pro.
The First Way To Edit Subtitle In Adobe Premiere Pro   Go to Window > Caption
Click on the captions tab to edit your subtitle in Adobe Premiere Pro  
  Click import settings. Here, you can preset the settings of your subtitles, such as font style, font size, and subtitle location.
Click import to edit your subtitle in Adobe Premiere Pro  
  By doing this method, all of your subtitle settings will be unified.
Caption import settings at Adobe Premiere Pro  
  The Second Way To Edit Subtitle In Adobe Premiere Pro  Make sure that your SRT file is already available on your timeline. Double click on your subtitle file. The captions window will open. Here, you can individually edit each subtitle.  This method is good if you just want to edit some parts of your subtitle.Individually edit your subtitle at Adobe Premiere Pro  
What Do I Do If My SRT File Does Not Show In Adobe Premiere Pro? If you can’t see you SRT file in Adobe Premiere Pro, you may want to try the following:
  Click on the wrench icon on your timeline.
Click on the wrench icon in Adobe Premiere Pro  
  Go to Closed Captions Display and make sure that it is enabled.
Make sure to enable closed captions display in Adobe Premiere Pro to have subtitle  
  Exporting Video With Subtitle In Adobe Premiere Pro To export a video with subtitle in Adobe Premiere Pro, you can do the following:
 Click File > Export. Alternatively, you can type command + M. Select your export setting format and preset. Click export.  Your video will automatically have baked-in subtitle.
Conclusion In this article, we have talked about what an SRT is, different ways to create an SRT file, how to import and edit SRT file to Adobe Premiere Pro and how to export video with subtitle in Adobe Premiere Pro.
Now that you are an expert, why don’t you try VideoTranslator to transcribe, translate and dub your video? Read how you can conveniently translate your video here.
For more information regarding VideoTranslator, do not hesitate to contact us at hello@videotranslator.ai.
See you next time for more educational blog posts!
title: How To Import And Edit SRT File To Adobe Premiere Pro

Halo, semuanya!
Beberapa minggu yang lalu, kita baru aja ngeupload artikel tentang 9 video editor terbaik untuk iOS.
Nah, salah satu aplikasi yang kita tampilkan adalah Splice.
Kali ini, kita bakalan memberikan review jujur tentang aplikasi editor video Splice!
Apa Itu Splice Splice adalah aplikasi pengeditan video gratis dari pencipta GoPro.
Aplikasi ini mengklaim bahwa mereka memungkinkan pengguna untuk:
 Memotong klip video Menyesuaikan kecepatan video Menghapus latar belakang video Menambahkan filter dan efek pada video Menambahkan judul, overlay teks, dan outro Membuat tayangan slide video  Apa Yang Akan Kami Ulaskan Di artikel kali ini, kami akan mengulas tentang seberapa bagus Splice dalam:
 Memangkas dan memotong video klip Menambahkan overlay video atau gambar Menambahkan filter, efek dan mask pada video Menambahkan texts Menambahkan musik/audio  Menurut kami, 5 hal diatas adalah atribut paling dasar yang harus dimiliki video editor.
Kesan Pertama Dari Aplikasi Splice Seperti aplikasi lainnya, Splice akan meminta kalian untuk membuat akun ketika pertama kali menggunakan aplikasinya.
Kemudian, aplikasi ini akan menanyakan beberapa pertanyaan, seperti:
 Apa level video editing kalian Dimana kalian biasanya membagikan video kalian Apa yang membawa kalian ke Splice  Kesan pertama dari aplikasi editor video Splice di iOS  
Aplikasi ini kemudian akan mengajak kalian untuk mencoba Splice Pro. Menurut kami, hal ini sangat bagus agar orang-orang tau bahwa ada versi berbayar dari aplikasi ini. Artinya, akan ada beberapa fitur yang dikunci jika kalian tidak mengikuti versi berbayar dari aplikasi ini.
Kalau kalian sedang mengedit video, akan lebih baik jika kalian mengetahui sebelumnya bahwa beberapa fitur tidak akan tersedia dalam versi gratis daripada ketika kalian sudah selesai mengedit video dan baru sadar kalau video yang baru kalian edit tidak bisa disimpan karena kalian tidak menggunakan versi pro.
Memulai Projek Baru Menggunakan Splice Sebelum kalian memulai projek baru, Splice memperbolehkan penggunanya untuk menambahkan judul projek dan memodifikasi aspek rasio dari video pengguna. Kalian bisa mengganti rasio dari video tergantung dari lokasi dimana kalian ingin membagikan video kalian.
Memilih aspek rasio video ketika memulai projek baru menggunakan Splice  
Contohnya, kalau kalian ingin mengedit video TikTok, kalian bisa memilih rasio 9:16 mode portrait.
Untuk kasus kami, kami hanya ingin membuat video landscape, maka kami memilih rasio 16:9 landscape.
Mengedit Video Menggunakan Splice Setelah menambahkan judul projek, media dan memilih rasio video, kami mulai proses mengedit video.
Memangkas dan Memotong Klip Video Memangkas Video Memangkas video menggunakan Splice merupakan proses yang cukup mudah. Kalian hanya perlu memencet media kalian dan menarik ujung dari klip yang kalian pilih, kemudian geser klip tersebut untuk menyingkatkan durasi video.
Memotong Video Berikut merupakan cara memotong video di Splice:
Memotong video kalian menggunakan editor video Splice di iOS  
 Pencet media yang kalian inginkan Pilih lokasi dimana kalian ingin memotong media kalian Garis kuning seperti foto diatas merupakan tanda dimana media kalian akan dipotong Pencet media kalian sekali lagi Pencet split Media kalian akan dibagi menjadi 2 media yang berbeda  Menambahkan Overlay Video/Gambar Cara menambahkan overlay video atau gambar  Pastikan bahwa video/gambar yang ingin kalian tambahkan sudah berada di timeline kalian. Pencet dan tahan media yang ingin kalian tambahkan sebagai overlay. Tarik klip ke bagian dengan tulisan ‘drop here to turn into an overlay’ Sesuaikan durasi overlay kalian seperti cara memangkas video  Menambahkan overlay di editor video Splice untuk iOS  
Hal bagus dari Splice adalah kalian bisa mengubah ukur video atau gambar yang kalian tambahkan sebagai overlay. Hal ini berarti kalian bisa menambhkan logo ke video kalian menggunakan fungsi overlay.
Tips: kalian bisa mengubah ukuran video/gambar ketika ditambahkan sebagai overlay.
Menambahkan Filter, Efek dan Mask Pada Video Menambahkan Filter Untuk menambahkan filter, kalian harus :
 Pencet media kalian Klik ikon filter di daerah bawah di timeline Pilih filter yang kalian inginkan Atur level filter yang kalian pilih  Tips: Kalau kalian mengklik ikon centang ganda di bagian bawah timeline, kalian bisa menerapkan filter ke semua media.
Menambahkan Efek Untuk menambahkan efek ke media, kalian harus:
  Pencet ikon efek di bawah timeline. Pastikan bahwa kalian tidak sedang memencet media kalian kalau tidak kalian tidak akan bisa melihat efek ikon.
  Pilih efek yang ingin kalian tambahkan
  Kalian bisa memilih bagian video mana yang akan mendapatkan efek dengan menggeser efek yang kalian tambahkan di timeline.
Menambahkan Mask   Menambahkan mask di editor video Splice untuk iOS  
Setelah kalian memilih efek video, kalian juga bisa menambahkan mask dengan memencet ikon mask disamping ikon efek.
Disini, kalian bisa memilih berbagaimacam opsi mask seperti bulat, garis, cermin atau kotak. Dengan menambahkan fungsi mask, kalian bisa menambahkan efek hanya didaerah yang sudah di mask.
Menambahkan Tulisan Untuk menambahkan tulisan, kalian harus memencet ikon title di bawah timeline.
Splice akan memperlakukan semua tulisan sebagai judul, jadi kalian harus memastikan bahwa latar belakang teks sudah kalian hapus jika teks tersebut akan digunakan sebagai subtitle.
Setelah itu, kalian bisa mengetuk dua kali di layar kalian dan mengetik judul/subtitle yang kalian inginkan.
Menambahkan tulisan di editor video Splice untuk iOS  
Kalian bisa mengatur waktu tayang tulisan dengan menggeserkannya di timeline.
Kalian juga bisa mengatur ukuran tulisan dengan mencubit teksnya.
Hal minus:
 Fungsi teks muncul secara acak di timeline. Splice tidak bisa memunculkan lokasi teks secara otomatis disamping teks terakhir yang sudah ditambahkan. Oleh karena itu, kalian harus selalu mengatur durasi waktu teks. Kalian tidak bisa melihat size dari font sehingga size font kalian tidak akan sama. Tidak ada font style yang tersedia  Menambahkan Music/Audio Menambahkan Musik Di Splice Kalian bisa menambahkan music ke video kalian dengan memencet ikon musik di bawah timeline.
Kalian bisa memilih antara mengimpor musik kalian sendiri atau mencari ribuan musik dari galeri Splice. Namun, musik dari galeri Splice hanya bisa dipakai jika kalian langganan Splice Pro.
Efek suara di editor video Splice untuk iOS  
Tips - kalian bisa menambahkan efek suara seperti tepuk tangan, suara jalan, latar suara, dll.
Menambahkan Audio Di Splice Untuk menambahkan audio di Splice, kalian harus pertama-tama menentukan dibagian mana kalian ingin menambahkan suara. Setelah itu, kalian bisa mulai merekam suara dengan memencet ikon voice di bawah timeline. Suara kalian akan secara otomatis direkam begitu ikon voice dipencet.
Kalau kalian punya file audio dan musik, kalian bisa memencet ikon musik untuk mengganti editan dari file audio dan musik.
Klik ikon musik untuk menggantikan antara mengedit musik atau suara di editor video Splice untuk iOS  
Hal minus - kalian tidak bisa memencet dan menahan layar untuk merekam suara. Begitu suara direkam, kalian harus lanjut berbicara karena suara terus menerus direkam.
Mengekspor Hasil Editan Kalian Dari Splice Ketika menyimpan video dari Splice, kalian bisa memilih resolusi dari video kalian. Kalian bisa memilih dari Ultra - 4k, Full HD, HD, atau large.
Menyimpan file kalian di video editor Splice untuk iOS  
Besar file kalian akan bergantung pada resolusi yang kalain pilih.
Hasil Akhir Dari Menggunakan Editor Video Splice Nonton video dibawah ini untuk melihat hasil editan dari Splice. Jangan lupa untuk mengatur subtitle bahasa Indonesia di video ini, ya.
  Kami Mengedit Video Dari iPhone Menggunakan Editor Video Splice
   Seperti yang kalian lihat, teks yang dihasilkan Splice tidak enak dilihat karena memiliki ukuran yang berbeda dan hanya memiliki satu font style.
Hal Positif Dari Menggunakan Splice  Memangkas dan memotong video sangat gampang dilakukan Ukuran video/gambar bisa diubah ketika ditambahkan sebagai overlay Filter bisa ditambahkan ke semua media dengan 1 klik Mask berfungsi dengan bagus Kalian bisa menambahkan banyak lagu yang bagus jika kalian berlangganan Splice Pro Galeri efek suara Splice sangat bagus  Hal Minus Dari Menggunakan Splice  Fungsi teks muncul secara acak di timeline. Splice tidak bisa memunculkan lokasi teks secara otomatis disamping teks terakhir yang sudah ditambahkan. Oleh karena itu, kalian harus selalu mengatur durasi waktu teks. Kalian tidak bisa melihat size dari font sehingga size font kalian tidak akan sama. Tidak ada font style yang tersedia Kalian tidak bisa memencet dan menahan layar untuk mereka suara. Begitu suara mulai direkam, kalian harus terus berbicara.  Kesimpulan Secara keseluruhan, kami memberi Splice 4 dari 5 bintang.
Splice adalah aplikasi yang bagus untuk mengedit video. Aplikasi ini mudah digunakan dan memiliki banyak alat untuk mengedit video. Namun, aplikasi ini tidak bagus untuk menambahkan tulisan.
Kalau kalian ingin menambahkan tulisan ke video kalian atau file SRT untuk postingan YouTube, kalian bisa menggunakan Video Translator! Video Translator juga bisa mentranskripsikan video kalian secara otomatis, loh!
Cara Mentranskripsikan Video Kalian Dengan Video Translator Untuk mentranskrip konten suara dengan Video Translator, ikuti langkah-langkah berikut:

contents:
Hello, fam!
A few weeks back, we have just released an article about the 9 of iOS top video editing apps.
One of the apps that we mentioned in that article is Splice.
So, today, we are going to give you our honest review of the video editing app Splice!
What Is Splice Splice is a free video editing app from the creators of GoPro.
The app claims that it will allow users to:
 Trim, cut, crop video clips Adjust the video speed Overlay videos and apply masks Remove video backgrounds Apply filters and effects on the videos Add titles, text overlays, and outro Create video slideshows  What We Will Be Judging In this article, we will be judging how good Splice is at:
 Trimming and cutting video clips Adding video/image overlays Applying filters, effects, and masks on videos Adding texts Adding music/audio  We picked these 5 items as they are the basic attributes of short video editing.
First Impression Of The Splice App Just like any other application, Splice will ask you to sign up when you first open the application.
It then will ask you some questions, such as:
 What is your video editing level Where will you share your videos the most What brings you to Splice  First Impression Of The Splice Video Editor On iOS  
It will then ask you to try Splice Pro, which in our opinion is a good thing. It means that people will be well aware that there is a paid version of the app and that some features will be locked if you don’t subscribe to the pro version.
It is better to know up front that some features won’t be available in the free version than to have finished editing your video and finding out that you can’t save the video because you are not on the pro version.
Starting A New Project With Splice Before you begin a new project, Splice allows you to add a project title and modify your video’s aspect ratio. This means that you can change the ratio depending on the location you want to share the video.
Choose your video aspect ratio when starting a project on Splice  
For example, if you want to edit TikTok videos, you can choose the 9:16 Portrait mode.
In our case, we just want to make a regular landscape video. Hence, the 16:9 landscape ratio is chosen.
Editing Video With Splice After the add the project title and media and choosing the video ratio, we began editing the video.
Trimming and cutting video clips Trimming The Video It is fairly easy to trim videos on Splice. You just have to tap on your media and you can drag the edge clip and slide it to trim your videos.
Cutting The Video Here is how you can cut your videos on Splice:
Split you video on Splice video editor iOS  
 Tap on the media of your choice Locate where you want to cut the media The yellow line is the guideline on where your media will be cut Tap on the media of your choice again Tap split Your media will be separated into 2 different clips  Adding Video/Image Overlays Add video/image overlays:  Make sure that the video/image that you want to add to the overlay is in your timeline Press and hold on to the media that you want to be added as an overlay Drag the clip to the ‘drop here to turn into an overlay’ tab Trim your clip the same way as you would trim a normal video  Adding an overlay in Splice  
The great part about Splice is that you can resize the video/image that you want to add as an overlay. This means that you can add your logo to your video with the overlay tool.
Tips: you can resize video/image when adding it as an overlay
Applying Filters, Effects, and Masks On Videos Applying Filters To add filters on your media, you have to:
 Tap on your media Click the filter icon at the bottom of the timeline Choose the filter of your choice Adjust the filter level  Tips: If you click on the double tick icon at the bottom of your timeline, you can apply the filter to all of your media.
Applying Effects To add effects on your media, you have to:
Tap the effects icon at the bottom of your timeline. Make sure that you are not currently tapping on your media or else you won’t be able to find the effects icon.
Choose which effect that you want to add
You can choose which part of your video will get the effects by sliding the effect tab on your timeline
Applying Masks Mask effect on Splice video editor iOS  
After you choose the video effects, you can choose the mask by tapping on the mask icon next to the effects icon.
Here, you can choose different masking options such as circle, line, mirror, and rectangle. By applying the mask function, only the area where you apply the mask will get the effects.
Adding Texts To add texts, you need to tap on the title icon at the bottom of your timeline.
Splice will treat all texts as titles, so you need to make sure that you delete the blank background if you want to make the text as a subtitle.
After that, you want to double-tap the media screen and type the title/subtitles that you want
Adding text on Splice video editor iOS  
You can adjust the timing of your text by sliding it around the timeline
You can also adjust the size by pinching on the text
Minus points:
 The text function will pop randomly across the timeline. It does not automatically show next to the last available text so you need to adjust the timing all the time. You can’t see the font size so your text sizes won’t be uniform There is only one font style  Adding Music/Audio Adding Music To Splice You can add music to your videos by clicking on the music icon at the bottom of your timeline.
You can choose to either import your own music or browse thousands of music from Splice gallery. However, the music from Splice gallery is only available if for Splice Pro users.
Sound effects on Splice video editor iOS  
Bonus point - you can add sound effects such as claps, footsteps, background noises, etc.
Adding Audio To Splice To add audio to Splice, you first have to set the time at which you want the voice recording to start. Once you have set that up, you can click on the voice icon at the bottom of the timeline and it will automatically record your audio.
If you have both audio and music, you can tap the music icon to switch the view between the audio and music.
Click on the music icon to switch between editing audio and music on Splice video editor iOS  
Minus point - you cannot hold and record your audio, meaning that once the audio starts recording, you need to keep on talking.
Exporting Your Edited Video From Splice When saving a video from Splice, it allows you to choose the resolution of your choice. You can choose from Ultra - 4k, Full HD, HD, or large.
Saving your file from Splice video editor iOS  
The size of the file will depend on the resolution that you choose.
End-Result Of Using Splice Video Editor Watch the video below to see what our video looks like after editing it from Splice.
  We edited a video from iPhone by using Splice Video Editor
   As you can see from the video, the texts do not look nice. The sizes are all different and there is only 1 font style.
Plus Points Of Using Splice  Trimming and cutting videos is easy to do Video/image can be resized when added as an overlay Filters can be added to all media in 1 click Mask function works well You can add many good songs from the Splice library if you use the Pro version The sound effect library is great  Minus Points of Using Splice  The text function will pop randomly across the timeline. It does not automatically show next to the last available text so you need to adjust the timing all the time. You can’t see the font size so your text sizes won’t be uniform There is only one font style You cannot hold and record your audio, meaning that once the audio starts recording, you need to keep on talking.  Conclusion Overall, we give Splice 4 stars out of 5.
Splice is a great app to edit your videos. It is easy to use and comes with a lot of editing tools. However, it is not so good when it comes to adding text.
If you want to add captions to your video or to add an SRT file for your YouTube post, you can use Video Translator to do it! Plus, Video Translator can automatically transcribe your video!
How To Transcribe Your Video With Video Translator To transcribe audio content with Video Translator, follow the below process:
Transcribe your video with VideoTranslator.ai  
 Log in to your Video Translator account. Upload your video using the quicktranscribe button. Select the language and dialect of the video and click the accept button to trigger the transcription. The transcription process will run in the background. Once the transcription is complete, go through and check the transcription for proper grammar e.g. capitalisation and full stops. Embed the captions into the asset, or download the srt file separately.  We hope you enjoy our review of Splice!
See you next time for more video editing app reviews!
For more information about Video Translator, do not hesitate to contact us at hello@videotranslator.ai .

Belajar bahasa baru itu emang nggak mudah, tetapi nggak berarti harus sulit, kan?
Kalau kalian udah menyerah untuk belajar bahasa bari, kalian harus banget baca artikel ini!
Mari kita mulai!
Berikut adalah 10 tip untuk kalian yang mau belajar bahasa baru:
1. Cari Motivasi Cari motivasi untuk belajar bahasa baru  
Menemukan motivasi adalah tip yang paling penting buat kalian yang mau belajar bahasa baru. Yang pastinya, kalian pasti pengen pengalaman belajar kalian itu menyenangkan dan mengasyikkan, bukannya malah membosankan dan melelahkan.
Jadi, gimana caranya supaya kalian bisa menemukan motivasi?
Motivasi itu bisa didapatkan di mana saja!
Waktu aku masih kecil, motivasi aku untuk belajar bahasa Inggris adalah supaya aku bisa ngerti apa aja sih yang para artis bicarakan waktu diwawancarai di TV.

Agak garing, ya… Tapi berhasil, loh!
Motivasi kalian bisa aja untuk terhubung kembali dengan budaya kalian, membangun koneksi baru atau menjelajahi budaya lain.
Menemukan motivasi bakalan membantu kalian supaya tetap berkomitmen dalam perjalanan belajar bahasa baru.
2. Menentukan Tujuan Ketika aku masih kuliah, aku diajarin tentang akronim penentuan tujuan yang SMAART.
Buat goal yang SMAART  
Sasaran SMAART adalah singkatan dari spesifik (specific), terukur (measurable), agresif namun dapat dicapai (agressive yet achievable), relevan (relevant), dan terikat waktu (time-bound).
Ketika tujuan kalian ditetapkan dengan akronim ini, kalian bisa mencapai hasil yang lebih besar karena kalian tahu persis apa yang kalian inginkan.
Contoh tujuan SMAART bisa seperti:
 Aku pengen bisa menonton Drama Korea tanpa subtitle dalam enam bulan. Untuk mencapai tujuan ini, aku bakalan mempelajari 20 kalimat baru setiap hari.
 Dalam 6 bulan, kalian bakalan mempelajari 18.000 kata baru!
Memiliki tujuan SMAART akan membantu kalian mencapai tujuan dengan lebih cepat.
3. Menonton Film/Drama Asing Menonton Film/Drama Asing  
Tip ini adalah tip favorit aku.
Tentu saja, mempelajari tata bahasa dalam bahasa baru itu penting. Tapi dalam dunia nyata, penutur asli juga tidak berbicara seperti apa yang diajarkan oleh buku teks.
Bahasa buku teks itu terlalu kaku.
Jadi, apa cara terbaik untuk berbicara bahasa seperti yang dilakukan penduduk asli? Tonton acara asing.
Dengan menonton Serial TV Bahasa Inggris, aku bisa belajar bahasa-bahasa gaul.
Kalian juga lebih mudah untuk mengetahui kata-kata baru dengan menonton acara asing.
Misalnya, ketika aku sedang menonton Drama Korea, kalimat berikut terus diulang-ulang:

4. Berbicara Dengan Orang Lain Berbicara Dengan Orang Lain  
Salah satu tantangan dalam mempelajari bahasa baru adalah tidak memiliki siapa pun untuk berlatih.
Waktu aku masih sekolah, aku nggak bisa ngomong Bahasa Mandarin secara lancar karena aku nggak punya siapa-siapa buat berlatih.
Orangtuaku nggak bisa ngomong Bahasa Mandarin, dan teman-teman sekelasku juga nggak jago ngomong Bahasa Mandarin.
Waktu aku mulai kerja sampingan di Australia, teman kerjaku banyak yang dateng dari Tiongkok. Aku bahkan belajar lebih banyak kalimat-kalimat mandarin dalam durasi itu dibandingkan selama 12 tahun sekolah.
Kalau kalian nggak punya teman untuk latihan, kalian bisa coba mencari teman lewat internet, seperti Twitter, Reddit atau di game online.
Aku sendiri punya banyak kawan di Twitter dan udah ketemu lumayan banyak dari mereka di berbagai negara.
5. Tinggalkan Zona Nyaman Waktu aku masih sekolah, aku tau beberapa orang yang besar di Indonesia tapi nggak bisa berbicara Bahasa Indonesia. Mereka sekolah di sekolah yang menggunakan Bahasa Inggris sebagai metode belajar, tinggal di lingkungan ynag penuh dengan orang asing dan hanya berkawan dengan orang asing. Mereka nggak punya alasan untuk belajar Bahasa Indonesia.
Tinggalkan Zona Nyaman  
Kalau kalian emang pengen belajar bahasa yang baru, kalian harus tinggalin zona nyaman kalian dan berkawan dengan orang-orang baru, terutama orang yang bisa berbicara bahasa yang ingin kalian kuasai.
Aspek yang lain selain dari meninggalkan zona nyaman adalah untuk percaya diri dalam berkomunikasi dalam bahasa asing.
Aku dulu susah banget buat belajar Bahasa Mandarin soalnya aku minder. Bahasa Mandarin memiliki banyak intonasi dan intonasi yang berbeda memiliki arti yang beda juga.
Aku dulu sering diejek kalau cara bacanya salah, jadinya aku nggak percaya diri lagi.
Waktu aku udah kerja sambilan, kawan kerjaku dari Tiongkok nggak pernah ngetawain cara aku ngomong dalam Bahasa Mandarin. Bahkan, mereka malah ngajarin aku untuk ngomong dengan cara yang benar. Hal ini lah yang beneran ngebantu aku buat percaya diri dalam berkomunikasi di Bahasa Mandarin.
Ninggalin zona nyaman kalian itu emang menakutkan, tapi 100% worth it!
6. Mendengarkan Podcast Mendengarkan Podcast  
Kalau kalian nggak punya waktu untuk nonton film, serial tv atau video, kalian harus banget dengerin podcast. Sekarang ini banyak banget program bahasa yang tersedia dalam bentuk podcast di Spotify atau Apple Podcast.
Kalian bisa download programnya atau streaming waktu kalian on the way kerja.
Dengan dengerin podcast, kalian bisa jadi lebih terbiasa dengan kata-kata bahasa asing.
Kalian juga bisa cepetin kecepatan podcastnya kalau menurut kalian si pembicara berbicara terlalu pelan atau memperlambat kecepatan podcastnya kalau si pembicara berbicara terlalu cepat.
7. Buat Flash Cards Buat kalian yang belum tau apa itu flashcard, flashcard adalah metode belajar dengan menggunakan kartu-kartu yang biasanya bergambar.
Belajar menggunakan flash cards  
Ketika kalian belajar bahasa yang baru dengan membaca buku, kalian bisa merasa kewalahan dengan jumlah kata yang kalian lihat.
Flashcards bakalan membantu kalian untuk belajar dengan mudah.
 “Flash card memberi otak Anda cara yang sangat cepat untuk memeriksa apakah Anda menjawab dengan benar. Mereka juga membantu Anda terlibat dalam ingatan aktif, yang mengajarkan otak Anda untuk mengingat suatu istilah, konsep atau proses tanpa petunjuk konteks. Mereka memungkinkan Anda untuk mengulangi tindakan tersebut. belajar dan menghafal sampai Anda menjadi ahli informasi, “kata Direktur Pemasaran Peterson’s, Elizabeth Barry.
 8. Menulis Menurut para ahli, menulis membantu kalian dalam meningkatkan kemampuan mengingat sesuatu.
Latihan menulis dalam bahasa asing  
Oleh karena itu, kalian harus berlatih menulis dalam bahasa target kalian.
Nggak harus berupa esai, kalian cukup menulis ulang teks, puisi, atau cerita pendek.
Inti dari latihan menulis adalah untuk membantu kalian membiasakan diri dengan kata-kata dan membantu kalian mengingat hal-hal yang sudah kalian pelajari.
9. Membaca Membaca untuk belajar bahasa asing  
Membaca teks dalam bahasa yang ingin kalian pelajari bakalan membantu kalian untuk melatih pengucapan kata.
Cobalah membaca buku dengan suara keras.
Kalian bisa berhenti waktu kalian ketemu kata yang asing, kemudian kalian tulis kata tersebut, terjemahkan dan lanjut membaca.
Kalau kalian terus menerus menggulang proses ini, kalian pasti bisa menguasai bahasa baru!
10. Latihan Setiap Hari Memiliki rutinitas akan membantu kalian dalam menghilangkan gangguan karena kalian hanya fokus pada hal-hal yang penting.
kalau kalian pengen belajar bahasa baru, jangan cuman latihan dua hari sekali. Kemungkinan besar kalian bakalan lupa apa yang sudah kalian pelajari atau kehilangan motivasi.
Buat jadwal harian yang dapat mengakomodasi tujuan SMAART kalian.
Membuat jadwal belajar bahasa asing  
Latihan bisa dilakukan dalam berbagai bentuk, seperti yang sudah aku katakan di tip sebelumnya. Berikut ini contohnya …
Kalau kalian mau belajar bahasa Spanyol, kalian bisa melakukan ini:
Senin: menonton film Spanyol setelah bekerja atau sekolah
Selasa: Lakukan panggilan zoom dengan teman online Spanyol kalian
Rabu: Habiskan malam kalian dengan orang-orang dari komunitas Spanyol
Kamis: Dengarkan podcast bahasa Spanyol dalam perjalanan ke kantor
Jumat: Membaca artikel berita Spanyol di pagi hari
Sabtu: Tulis puisi Spanyol sebelum melakukan tugas Anda
Minggu: Bacalah buku bahasa Spanyol sebelum tidur
Berlatih setiap hari tidak harus membosankan. Kalian bisa melakukan berbagai hal selama kalian melakukannya secara teratur.
Nah, sekarang kalian udah siap untuk menguasai bahasa baru. Yuk, cobain alat kami yang bisa membantu kalian menerjemahkan konten video dengan cepat dan efisien!
Di Video Translator, kami menggunakan kecerdasan buatan untuk menerjemahkan video kalian dengan mudah.
Cari tahu kenapa kalian harus menggunakan penerjemah yang didukung kecerdasan buatan di sini atau hubungi kami di hello@videotranslator.ai untuk informasi lebih lanjut.

contents:
Saat ini, terdapat lebih dari 7,000 bahasa di dunia. Meskipun kedengarannya banyak, kenyataannya banyak dari bahasa-bahasa ini yang hampir punah. Oleh karena itu, saat ini banyak sekali perusahaan yang memanfaatkan kemajuan teknologi untuk melestarikan bahasa yang hampir punah dan untuk mengatasi kendala bahasa.
Kami sudah merangkum 4 berita terbaru di industri teknologi terjemahan dalam artikel kali ini.
Berita Terbaru Di Industri Teknologi Terjemahan  
Yuk, kita cari tau!
1. Google Untuk Melestarikan Bahasa yang Terancam Punah Dengan Kecerdasan Buatan Google Arts & Culture adalah platform online berisi gambar dan video resolusi tinggi karya seni dan artefak budaya dari organisasi budaya di seluruh dunia.
Platform online nirlaba baru-baru ini memutuskan untuk melestarikan bahasa yang terancam punah dalam bentuk aplikasi sumber terbuka berbasis kecerdasan buatan yang bernama Woolaroo. Nah, Woolaroo ini bakalan membantu mempromosikan bahasa yang terancam punah dengan menggunakan alat interaktif dan pendidikan.
Aplikasi Woolaroo untuk mempromosikan bahasa yang terancam punah | Kredit foto: Experiments With Google  
Woolaroo menggunakan kamera hp seseorang untuk menemukan suatu objek, kemudian objek tersebut diterjemahkan ke dalam kata aslinya dan dilengkapi dengan cara pengucapan. Karena ini adalah aplikasi sumber terbuka, siapa pun bisa berkontribusi ke perpustakaan Woolaroo.
Platform Woolaroo saat ini tersedia dalam 10 bahasa yang berbeda, termasuk Bahasa Yugambeh yang merupakan bahasa asli dari Queensland Selatan dengan hanya satu penutur yang masih hidup, dan Nawat yang memiliki kurang dari 500 penutur. Aplikasi ini tersedia dalam bahasa Inggris, Spanyol, Arab, Prancis, Italia.
Wah, keren banget yang platform ini. Coba kita banyangin, teman-teman, seandainya paltform ini juga bisa menampilkan bahasa-bahasa daerah Indonesia. Misalnya, kita bisa ngeliat objek berupa meja yang kemudian diterjemahkan ke bahasa daerah seperti Bahasa Batak atau Jawa. Pastinya bakalan menarik minat orang banyak untuk belajar bahasa daerah!
Kalian bisa bahasa daerah, nggak?
2. Aplikasi Yang Bisa Menerjemah Panggilan Telepon Secara Langsung Kalian mungkin pernah mendengar tentang terjemahan video, transkripsi dan terjemahan live, tapi kalian pernah nggak dengar tentang penerjemah panggilan telepon secara langsung? iTourTranslator dengan inovasinya bisa memungkinkan terjemahan telepon secara langsung. Begini cara kerjanya.
Aplikasi iTourTranslator yang bisa menerjemahkan panggilan telepon secara langsung | Kredit Foto: iTourTranslator  
Pertama-tama, kalian harus mengirim link ke penerima panggilan telepon. Panggilan tersebut bisa dilakukan dari berbagai platform sosial seperti WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger, Line, Telegram, atau WeChat. Panggilan yang diterjemahkan ini baru bisa dilakukan ketika penerima mengklik link. Yang kerennya, si penerima tidak perlu mengunduh atau mendaftarkan diri ke aplikasi iTourTranslator. Praktis banget, kan!
Nah, misalnya si penelepon berbicara dalam bahasa Inggris dan kalian sebagai penerima berbicara dalam bahasa Indonesia. Ketika si penelepon berbicara, kalian akan mendapatkan pesan yang sudah diterjemahkan ke dalam bahasa Indonesia, dan ketika kalian menjawab dalam bahasa Indonesia, penelepon akan mendapatkan pesan yang sudah diterjemahkan ke bahasa Inggris.
iTourTranslator saat ini mendukung bahasa-bahasa berikut: Inggris, Spanyol, Jerman, Prancis, Cina, Jepang, Korea, Rusia, Arab, Norwegia, Denmark, Finlandia, Portugis, Catalan, dan Thailand.
3. Alkitab Bahasa Isyarat Amerika Yang Pertama Setelah 15 tahun ,terjemahan Alkitab pertama di dunia ke dalam Bahasa Isyarat Amerika (American Sign Language) dalam versi video diselesaikan dengan bantuan hampir 100 sukarelawan.
 “Ini adalah pertama kalinya dalam sejarah, komunitas Tunarungu yaitu mereka yang membaca dan berbicara dalam bahasa isyarat, memiliki Alkitab lengkap yang tersedia bagi mereka di komunitas mana pun, di mana pun di dunia,” kata Robert J. Hendriks III, Juru Bicara Saksi-Saksi Yehuwa AS.
 Alkitab pertama dalam bahasa isyarat Amerika | Kredit Foto: JW.Org  
Alkitab bahasa isyarat ini awalnya dirancang untuk digunakan dalam DVD. Namun, seiring kemajuan teknologi, proyek tersebut dibuat menjadi video yang tersedia di aplikasi smartphone.
Semoga inovasi ini dapat menjadi awal terobosan bagi komunitas tunarungu dan tuli di seluruh dunia!
4. Siswi-Siswi Kamboja Membuat Aplikasi Terjemahan STEM (Sains, Teknologi, Teknik, dan Matematika) Ratantepy Narin, seorang siswa sekolah menengah di Kamboja, gemar mencari sumber belajar dari internet. Masalah terbesar yang dia temui adalah sebagian besar materi yang tersedia ditulis dalam bahasa Inggris. Untuk mengatasi masalah ini, dia dan tiga teman sekelasnya memutuskan untuk berpartisipasi dalam program kompetisi Technovation Girls.
Narin, Leakena Chea, Vuthnyneath Tep, dan Chherika Chheal membuat grup dengan nama Teen4tech. Dengan bantuan konsultan free lance Cassandra Mok, mereka memutuskan untuk membuat aplikasi.
Anggota Teen4Tech: Ratantepy Narin, Leakena Chea, Vuthnyneath Tep and Chherika Chheal | Kredit foto: Khmer Times  
Empat bulan kemudian, ScholarED dirilis. ScholarEd adalah sebuah aplikasi yang menerjemahkan terminologi kompleks dari mata pelajaran STEM dari bahasa Inggris ke Khmer.
 ‚ÄúKami berharap semua orang dapat mempelajari apa pun secara online. Kami tidak ingin kendala bahasa membatasi pengetahuan siapa pun atau potensi pendidikan online mereka, “kata Narin.
 Tim Teen4Tech telah menerima tanggapan positif. Semoga aplikasi ini dapat membantu masyarakat Kamboja mengembangkan potensinya di industri STEM.

The world has more than 7,000 languages. Although it may sound like a lot, the reality is that many of these languages are dying. To preserve a dying language and to combat the language barrier, many companies have made the best use out of the current technological advancements.
We have summed up 4 of the latest news in the translation technology industry in this blog post.
Latest News In The Translation Technology Industry Collage  
1. Google To Preserve Endangered Languages With AI Google Arts & Culture is an online platform of high-resolution images and videos of artworks and cultural artifacts from partner cultural organizations throughout the world.
Woolaroo App | Image Credit: Experiments With Google  
The not-for-profit online platform has recently decided to preserve endangered languages in the form of an artificial intelligence-based open-source application, Woolaroo. Woolaroo helps to promote endangered languages by using interactive and educational tools.
Woolaroo uses a person’s phone camera to discover an object and translate it into its native word with pronunciation. Since it is an open-source application, anyone can contribute to the Woolaroo library.
The platform is currently available in 10 different languages, including Yugambeh which is an aboriginal language from South Queensland with only one surviving speaker, and Nawat which has less than 500 speakers. The application is available in English, Spanish, Arabic, French, Italian.
2. Real-Time Phone Call Translator You would have heard of video translation, live transcription, and live translation, but have you heard about real-time phone call translator? iTourTranslator has made real-time phone translation possible. Here’s how it works.
iTourTranslator | Image Credit: iTourTranslator  
First, you would need to send a link to the phone call receiver. The call can be made from various social platforms such as WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger, Line, Telegram, or WeChat. The call translated call can be made when the receiver clicks on the link. The receiver does not need to download nor register to the app.
Let’s say the caller speaks English and the receiver speaks Indonesian. When the caller speaks, the receiver will get the message translated into Indonesian, and when the receiver replies in Indonesian the caller will get it translated into English.
iTourTranslator currently supports these languages: English, Spanish, German, French, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Russian, Arabic, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish, Portuguese, Catalan, and Thai.
3. First Available ASL (American Sign Language) Bible After a long 15 years, the world‚Äôs first Bible translation into American Sign Language (ASL) on video is completed with the help of nearly 100 volunteers.
American Sign Language Bible | Image Credit: JW.Org  
 “It was the first time in history, the Deaf community, those who read and spoke ASL, had a complete Bible available to them in any community, anywhere on the globe,” said Robert J. Hendriks III, U.S. Spokesman for Jehovah‚Äôs Witnesses.
 The ASL Bible was originally designed to be put on DVDs. However, as technology advances, the project is made into videos that are available on a smartphone app.
Hopefully, this innovation can be a beginning of a breakthrough for the deaf and hard of hearing communities around the world.
4. Cambodian Students Created A STEM Translation Application Ratantepy Narin, a Cambodian high school student, loves to find learning resources on the internet. The biggest problem she encountered was most of the materials were in English. To solve this problem, she and three of her classmates with the help of a local freelance consultant Cassandra Mok decided to build an app.
Narin, Leakena Chea, Vuthnyneath Tep, and Chherika Chheal under the name of Teen4tech created the app after participating in the Technovation Girls competition program.
Teen4Tech Members: Ratantepy Narin, Leakena Chea, Vuthnyneath Tep and Chherika Chheal | Image Credit: Khmer Times  
Four months later, ScholarED is released. ScholarEd is an app that translates the complex terminology of the STEM subjects from English to Khmer.
 ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hoping that everyone can learn anything online. We don‚Äôt want a language barrier to limit anyone‚Äôs knowledge or their potential online education,‚Äù said Narin.
 The Teen4Tech team has received positive feedback. Hopefully, the app can help Cambodians grow their potential in the STEM industry.
The Video Translator team is very happy to know that there are more people who are interested in translation technology. We understand the importance of language and we want to preserve that.
Here at Video Translator, you can transcribe, translate and dub your videos into 60+ languages and 150+ dialects. Our platform uses Artificial Intelligence to perform the mentioned services.
Our services have successfully made a meaningful impact on people. Read how we helped our client to leave a long-lasting legacy here.

  Memanfaatkan teknologi kecerdasan buatan
Salah satu cara yang paling gampang untuk mengubah bentuk lisan menjadi tulisan adalah dengan menggunakan teknologi kecerdasan buatan. Teknologi ini bisa mengubah bentuk lisan menjadi tulisan secara otomatis sehingga mempermudah proses transkripsi, tapi kekurangannya hasil yang dihasilkan nggak akurat. Oleh karena itu, teknologi ini masih membutuhkan campur tangan manusia untuk memastikan bahwa tulisan yang dihasilkan sudah akurat.
  Menulis transkripsi secara manual
Cara ini merupakan cara yang paling akurat dalam mengubah bentuk lisan menjadi tulisan, tapi memakan banyak waktu dan energi. Cara ini mengandalkan manusia untuk melakukan proses transkripsi. Hasil akhir dari metode ini akan sangat akurat.
  Manfaat Dari Transkripsi Video: Transkripsi video punya beragam manfaat, teman-teman. Salah satunya adalah agar bisa dicari oleh mesin pencari (search engine).

Jadi, gimana dong caranya supaya konten kalian bisa dicari oleh mesin pencari? Ya, kalian harus menggunakan transkripsi video. Setelah konten video memiliki transkripsi, mesin pencari baru bisa menampilkan konten kalian.

For people who have vision or hearing disabilities, adding the transcript makes all the difference!

Here at Video Translator, we love your questions. Receiving your questions mean that you are interested in the services we are offering.
Not long ago, we received an enquiry from a customer.
How do you know which dialect would work when transcribing videos  
 “Hello, there are YouTube videos in Arabic News. I would like to have them transcribed, translated and dubbed into the English language so that I can understand them. Would you all be able to do this?”
 Of course, we said yes! That is precisely why we are here.
We offered him a quote that ranges between 10-25 USD per minute depending on the content’s complexity and whether he wanted an AI or Human dubbing.
The cost is relatively higher than the .15 cents per minute along with the $10 monthly fee and .30 per minute with no monthly fee with the AI usage. The high cost is, of course, if we do it for him as a managed service.
There is a complex process when it comes to managed service. We need to hire professional translators, manually add the baked-in captions and adjust the voice dubbing. We want to make sure that the end result will give you the best value.
Video Translator's managed services  
You can find an example of how we did a managed service here.
In the end, Marcus decided to do it by himself because he wanted to have the videos translated regularly. So, he asked us how he can use the Video Translator app to translate his choice’s video contents.
We referred him to this link for help and documentation.
Within our conversation, Marcus asked a great question: How does he know which dialect would work for his choice videos?
which dialect would work for his choice videos  
There are multiple ways for you to find out the language dialect:
  Knowing or hiring a native speaker
Knowing or hiring a native speaker  
It is the best way to determine which dialect a person in a video is speaking. Native speakers will know exactly what dialect is being spoken.
  Having a basic understanding of the language
Having a basic understanding of the language  
This will help you determine the language dialect. For example, it would be relatively easier to distinguish between British and American English because almost everyone is familiar with it.
  Find the source of the video.
Finding video source  
For example, if your video is from YouTube, you can find out where the person is from. If the person is, let’s say, from Mexico, then the dialect the person is speaking is most probably Mexican Spanish.
  If you do not know a native speaker, do not speak the language and cannot find the video source, the only alternative is to pick any of the available language dialects. Most of the time, there won’t be much difference between different dialects.
There are probably some vocabulary differences. For example, Americans would say college. Meanwhile, the British would call it university.
For now, knowing which dialect a person is speaking is still a very complex thing for Artificial Intelligence to do. Of course, with the rapid development in technology, AI will soon be able to automatically determine a language’s dialect.
Conclusion There are three ways in which you can find out which dialect a person is speaking in the video you want to translate:
 Know or hire a native speaker Have a basic understanding of the target language Find the video source  Your feedback matters!  
We are also glad to have these kinds of questions. If you have more questions or feedback, do not hesitate to contact us at hello@videotranslator.ai!

Learning a new language is not easy, but it does not mean that it should be hard.
If you have given up the idea of being bilingual (or trilingual? Maybe multilingual?), you should definitely read this article!
Let’s begin!
Here are 10 tips for you if you want to learn a new language:
1. Find your motivation Find your motivation  
Finding your motivation is the most fundamental tip to learn a new language. You want your learning experience to be fun and exciting, not dull and exhausting.
So, how do you find your motivation?
You can find it everywhere!
When I was a kid, my motivation to learn English was to understand what the celebrities said when they were interviewed on TV.
Celebrity  
It is corny, I know, but it worked!
Your motivation can be to reconnect to your culture, build new connections or explore other cultures.
Finding your motivation will help you stay committed to your journey of learning a new language.
2. Set a goal When I was studying for my Bachelor’s degree, I discovered this cool goal-setting acronym called SMAART.
The SMAART goal stands for Specific, Measurable, Aggressive yet Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound.
SMART goal  
When goals are set with this acronym, greater outcomes can be reached since you know exactly what you want.
An example of a SMAART goal could be:
 I want to be able to watch Korean Drama without subtitles in six months. To reach this goal, I am going to learn 20 new phrases every day.
 In 6 months, you would have learnt 18,000 new phrases!
Having a SMAART goal will help you achieve your goal quicker.
3. Watch foreign shows Watching foreign shows  
This tip is my favourite.
Sure, learning your target language’s grammar is important. However, the native speakers don’t speak as to how the textbooks teach you.
The textbook language is way too formal.
So, what’s the best way to speak a language the way the natives do? Watch foreign shows.
By watching English TV Series, I was able to learn new slangs. I learn slangs such as “ditch”, “chill”, “slay”, “stan”, “spill the tea” by watching TV.
It is also easier to pick up new phrases by watching foreign shows.
For example, when I was watching a Korean Drama, these phrases are constantly repeated:
  Í∞ÄÏßÄÎßà/ga-ji-ma (don‚Äôt go)
K-drama: don't go  
  Î≥¥Í≥†Ïã∂Ïñ¥/bo-go-sip-eo (I miss you)
K-drama: i miss you  
  Í¥úÏ∞ÆÏïÑ/gwaenchanh-a (Ok or are you ok?)
K-drama: are you ok?  
  ÎØ∏ÏïàÌï¥/mian-hae (I’m sorry)
K-drama: i'm sorry  
  Ïñ¥ÎñªÍ≤å/eo-tteoh-ge (how?)
K-drama: how  
  So, now when I’m talking with my Korean friends, I will randomly insert those phrases in my sentence!
4. Converse with others Converse with others  
One of the challenges of learning a new language is not having anyone to practise with.
I could not master Mandarin when I was still in school because I had no one to practise with.
My parents do not speak Mandarin, and my classmates were just as terrible as I did.
When I started my part-time job, I had many Chinese friends. I learnt so much more new Mandarin phrases than I did for my 12-year Mandarin lessons back in school.
If you can’t find anyone to converse with, you can always find someone who is willing to on the internet. You can do it from Twitter, Reddit or even by playing online games!
I made so many good friends on Twitter, and I have met most of them in different countries!
5. Leave your comfort zone leave your comfort zone  
I know some people from school who have lived most of their lives in Indonesia but cannot converse in Bahasa Indonesia. They went to a school with English as a medium, lived in a neighbourhood full of expatriates and made friends with foreigners. They did not have a reason to learn Bahasa Indonesia.
If you really want to learn a new language, you need to leave your bubble and expand your network. Go make friends with people who speak your target language.
Another important aspect of leaving your comfort zone is to be confident in speaking your target language.
I struggled a lot to learn Mandarin because I was afraid of pronouncing the words wrong. Mandarin has different tones, and different tones have different meanings.
I was always made fun of when I pronounced the wrong words. It crushed my confidence.
When I conversed with my colleague during my part-time job, they never made fun of my ‘broken Mandarin’. They helped me pronounce the words correctly and boosted my confidence.
Leaving your comfort zone will be scary, but trust me, it is worth it!
6. Listen to podcasts listen to podcasts  
If you do not have time to watch movies, tv-series, or videos, you can always listen to podcasts. Nowadays, there are many language programs on Spotify or Apple Podcasts.
You can download the podcasts or stream them on the way to work.
Listening to podcasts will help you familiarize yourself with the words.
You can also increase the audio speed if you think that the speakers are speaking too slow or decrease the speed if you feel that they are talking too fast.
7. Make flashcards Make flashcards  
Flashcard is an effective tool to study.
When you learn a new language by reading a textbook, you can get overwhelmed by the number of words that you see.
Flashcards allow you to learn new words without cluttering your mind.
 “Flashcards give your brain a very quick way to check if you got the answer correct. They also help you engage in active recall, which teaches your brain to remember a term, concept or process without context clues. They allow you to repeat the act of learning and memorizing until you are an expert on the information,” said the Marketing Director of Peterson’s, Elizabeth Barry.
 8. Write Writing  
According to experts, writing by hand appears to improve our ability to remember things.
For this reason, you should definitely practise writing in your target language.
It does not have to be an essay. You can simply rewrite a text, poem, or short story.
The whole point of practise writing is to help you familiarize yourself with the words and help you remember the things.
9. Read Reading  
Reading a text in your target language will help you practise your pronunciation.
Try reading a book aloud.
You can stop when you find an unfamiliar word, write it down, find the meaning and resume.
If you keep on doing it, you will definitely be able to master your target language!
10. Practise every day 
Yes, you heard me right.
Practise every day!!!
Daily habits easily eliminate distractions because you are focused only on those things that need to be done.
If you want to learn a new language, don’t just do it every other day. You will most likely forget what you have learnt or lose your motivation.
Make a daily schedule that can accommodate your SMAART goal.
Practising can come in different forms, as I have said in the previous tips. Here is an example…
If you want to learn Spanish, you can do this:
Monday: watch a Spanish movie after work or school
Tuesday: Have a zoom call with your online Spanish friend
Wednesday: Spend your evening with people from the Spanish community
Thursday: Listen to Spanish podcasts on the way to work
Friday: Read a Spanish news article in the morning
Saturday: Write Spanish poems before doing your chores
Sunday: Read a Spanish book before going to bed
Practising every day does not have to be dull and boring. You can do different things as long as you keep on doing it regularly.

I was born in Indonesia, a country with over 250 million population scattered across its 17,000 islands. When I came to Australia four years ago, I noticed that most Australians with Indonesian background or mixed raced Indonesians do not know how to speak Indonesian.
Indonesia, the land with 17,000 islands  
So, I began to question myself: how important it is to learn a foreign language? I came up with few answers‚Ä¶
Learning a foreign language allows you to build connections If you didn‚Äôt know, Indonesia is a country with over 300 native languages. Growing up here, you would think that my mother tongue would be Bahasa Indonesia. However, my first language is a dialect from the South Sumatera province called Palembang.
Ampera Bridge in Palembang, South Sumatera, Indonesia  
 According to Asian Languages and Literature from the University of Washington, ‚ÄúWhile Bahasa Indonesia is spoken as a mother tongue by only 7% of the total population, it is the national language and is used by 200 million people as their second language.‚Äù
 If my mother tongue were not my local dialect, I would have struggled to communicate with my relatives. The locals take pride in speaking their local dialects.
Fun fact, if you travel to Indonesia, you will most probably get a discount if you can speak in their local dialect.
Although our local dialect is our mother tongue, most Indonesians can speak Bahasa Indonesia as it is our official language.
Bahasa Indonesia is commonly used for business and administrative purposes as well as by education institutions and mass media throughout the country to facilitate communication among the Indonesians.
My mind began to wander to the times when my family would travel to different provinces. We would visit some local shops to buy some souvenirs. Although the staffs would generally speak in a local dialect, they would immediately switch to Bahasa Indonesia when they talk to customers.
An Indonesian lady holding local street food  
If I hadn‚Äôt been able to speak Bahasa Indonesia, I would be stuck in my tiny little bubble in South Sumatera and struggle to communicate with everyone else across the country.
Learning a foreign language will help you see the world When I was in primary school, my parents sent me to study in a school that uses English as the medium of instruction. I struggled a lot in the beginning as none of my parents speaks English.
Little girl going to school  
As a kid, I was timid to speak English in front of anyone. I thought my English was terrible, and I didn‚Äôt know enough vocabularies to express how I feel.
I think it took me about six years to finally have the confidence in speaking English.
It was not until I was in middle school that I realized how blessed I am to understand English. That day, I wanted to share an online article with my parents. Since they do not speak English, I needed to find the translated version. However, I couldn‚Äôt find any!
Searching the internet  
There is limited information that you can have when you do not know how to speak a foreign language. By learning English, I was able to gain so much more information about everything I want to know.
Learning a foreign language deepen your connection to other cultures If there were one language that I regret not learning, it would be Mandarin. As an Indonesian with a Chinese background, my parents wanted me to know Mandarin. Their generation lost touch with their mother tongue because its use was banned in the country.
Chinese lantern  
As a young kid, I hated learning Mandarin. I would be sent to after-school Mandarin class and hated every bit of it. I was not good at it. I felt embarrassed when I speak the language because my friends would laugh at me.
Truth be told, I was proud to say to people that I was terrible in Mandarin. I boasted of my inability to speak a foreign language.
Looking back, I feel so silly. I wish I hadn‚Äôt done what I did.
When I moved to Australia, I had a part-time job in a caf√© where I worked with many Chinese people. That‚Äôs the moment that I realized that I should have taken my Mandarin classes seriously.
As a 21-year-old third-generation Chinese Indonesian, I know nothing about my history. I did not know even know the name of my great grandparents. Even if I did, I won‚Äôt be able to read their names because they would be written in Mandarin. This also means that I won‚Äôt be able to look for their names in the Chinese registry database.
Chinese calligraphy  
Sure, learning a foreign language gives you various advantages in life. However, you cannot possibly know all 7,000 languages.
So, what is the solution?

I believe everyone wants to leave a legacy.
Many people choose to pass on their homes, investments and possessions.
For Jeff Dormish, leaving a legacy means so much more than that. He does not just want to leave possessions; he wants to pass on his history.
For many Americans, most of their ancestors came from Europe in the great emigration wave before the First World War. Jeff Dormish‚Äôs ancestors also came from Europe, Slovenia, to be exact.
Slovenia  
In 2016, he began on a journey to discover his past.
Along with 49 other Americans, Jeff participated in an international genealogy conference organized by the Slovenian Genealogy Society.
Slovenian Genealogy Society International, Inc.  
On this trip, he directly saw and experienced the place where his ancestors had once resided. At that moment, the things that he had seen in pictures have come to life. Lucky for Jeff, the life-changing trip that he had undertaken was covered by a Slovenian TV station.
5 years later, Jeff has become the President of the Slovenian Genealogy Society International based in Cleveland, Ohio. He wanted to put the 12-minute video from the Slovenian TV coverage in the archive of the genealogy group, hoping that it could help and inspire others in a similar situation. However, it was primarily spoken in Slovenian, a language that he could neither speak nor understand.
Jeff wanted the video to be translated into English. That is when he contacted VideoTranslator. Equipped with the video and Jeff‚Äôs parent‚Äôs family picture, I began to do my work.
Transcribing The Video Before translating the video, I used VideoTranslator’s application that can automatically transcribe videos by using the AI system that is embedded in the app.

Translating The Video I understand that things can easily get lost in translation. That is why a professional translator was hired. The transcription from Video Translator’s app was transferred into a txt file and sent to a translator. The translator then came back with the translated subtitles of the video.
Creating Burnt-In Subtitles The original video has burnt-in subtitles in Slovenian. I wanted to make sure that the new burnt-in subtitles would match the current one.
First, I synced the translated subtitles to the video by using Adobe Premiere Pro. I shifted the timing a little bit to match the dialogues.
Editing Caption Timing on Adobe Photoshop  I also added a black background behind the text with 90% transparency to make it easier for people to read and match the style of the original video.
Editing Caption on Adobe Photoshop  After editing it, I saved the file with the burnt-in subtitles in the video.
After I sent the video with the burnt-in subtitles to Jeff, he asked me to fix some name spelling errors. I realized that the spelling errors were mainly from the original video, not from the translation.
Jeff Dormish Name Typo  So, how can I fix this problem?
I figured that I can fix this by adding a text overlay on top of the original one. I used matching font style and size and corrected the spelling errors.
Editing Jeff Dormish's Name  In the end, it looks like it was not edited at all!
Fixing Up Damaged Photo Jeff had sent us a picture of his parent‚Äôs family photo. However, the image is damaged with discolouration on the right side.
Dormish Family, Meyersdale, PA, 1928 Before Editing | Image Credit: Jeff Dormish  I know how much it would mean for him to have the picture fixed up, so I did.
I used Adobe Photoshop to fix the image. I replaced the damaged area with pixels from the undamaged picture by using the patch tool.
This is the end result.
Dormish Family, Meyersdale, PA, 1928 After Editing | Image Credit: Jeff Dormish  
What I Learnt Jeff‚Äôs story resonated with me. As an Indonesian of Chinese ancestry, I too often find myself wondering about my own families story.
Where were they from?
Why did they move?
Who were the important people in their lives?
I was born and raised in Indonesia.
My family does not speak mandarin, and my grandparents did not teach the Chinese dialect to me. Just like Jeff, language is a big challenge in discovering my own story.
Seeing how far Jeff has come and what he wanted to pass along to his children has inspired me. Someday I would also like to see the places where my people had lived, how they spent their lives, who their partners and children were, and untangle the mysteries of my past.
Conclusion Helping Jeff, who wants to leave a long-lasting legacy for his family, is one reason why we do what we do. We hope to help more people build legacies and find answers to their biggest questions in the future.
